Articles.Content:
Ive only had the game for not so very long, and i already love it. I've actually made a few mods of my own, based on parts other people have made(modding my own install). But now ive made something that id like to share, and im not entirely sure what the whole rules are on sharing parts that were made by someone else, im assuming i have to ask the original author for permission, but i dont know how to get ahold of him. I modified the Greenhouse by "r h". I made 3 others with the same basic configurations, only they generate different things, like liquidfuel and intakeair(dont ask). I have some more ideas for 'biofuels'. Perhaps even a biofuel engine! But i need permission, can a more seasoned space explorer point me in the right direction? That being said, this game is soooooo amazing! :3 I really want to get into my own mods. which will be mostly science/utility stuff.KFS stands for Kerbin Future Sciences, which is exactly what i hope to bring to the game. More scifi-like utility stuff. I cant model or mesh worth crap, but i can read the code. What exactly are the configuration files coded in? Ive always thought the game was majorly composed of C# (hence the .cs extensions eveywhere). Im a python person myself.

Sorry about all the um, rambling! i just really love this game ^______^

Heres a description of my greenhouses, the models are essentially the same as the one on the spaceport, only colored a bit different:

(The IKRBF is a subdivision of KFS, providing the top botanical scientists in all of Kerbol!)

title = Evine GreenHouse

manufacturer = International Kerbin Botanical Research Federation (IKBRF)

description = Advances in Kerbin botany allow plants to be converted to over the counter rocket fuel. Grown from samples taken from Eve, this module converts the alien plants into Oxidizer..somehow.

//These plants have been noted to grow like crazy in an artificial enviornment, you may not need many of these. As a byproduct of the conversion process,

//electricty is generated from this pod too.

title = Dunatrope GreenHouse

manufacturer = International Kerbin Botanical Research Federation (IKBRF)

description = Advances in Kerbin botany allow plants to be converted to over the counter rocket fuel. Grown from samples taken from Duna, this module converts the alien plants into Liquid Fuel..somehow.

//This module is the first in the line of Kerbin biofuels, several advances were made to increase output on all modules based on this design

title = Eeloowort GreenHouse

manufacturer = International Kerbin Botanical Research Federation (IKBRF)

description = Botanists were shocked when they discovered these samples. A plant that creates oxygen on a planet with no atmosphere? Unheard of! Yet the Eeloowort exists. Its name comes from the welts it left on several scientists hands. "It was a bit like frostbite" is all the cheif scientist had to say.
